KH.content: because philosophy can’t speak truly of that which looks like the mother, it speaks only of father/son, as if father engendered son all its own
KH.linkedContent: because philosophy can’t speak truly of that which looks like the mother, it speaks only of father/son, as if father engendered son all its own

R.content: Derrida, alongside Nancy in The Experience of Freedom, rethinks naissance > before genesis, creation, nation, nature [deconstruct fraternity]
R.linkedContent: Derrida, alongside Nancy in The Experience of Freedom, rethinks naissance > before genesis, creation, nation, nature [deconstruct fraternity]

OOG.content: doesn’t geometry have an infinite number of births which conceal it?
OOG.linkedContent: doesn’t geometry have an infinite number of births which conceal it?

OOG.content: Teleological Reason precedes philosophical sense-investigation which awakened Reason to itself > every self-awakening (naissance à soi) of a latent intention is a rebirth (radical, creative)
OOG.linkedContent: Teleological Reason precedes philosophical sense-investigation which awakened Reason to itself > every self-awakening (naissance à soi) of a latent intention is a rebirth (radical, creative)

MSUBJ.content: Artaud’s neologism innée, where nature collides w/ its contrary, “suffering of the pre-natal,” appears as monstrosity
MSUBJ.linkedContent: Artaud’s neologism innée, where nature collides w/ its contrary, “suffering of the pre-natal,” appears as monstrosity

MSUBJ.content: “nature” conceals even the source of its interdiction > Artaud wants to tear apart veil of birth and reveal “naked nature”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: “nature” conceals even the source of its interdiction > Artaud wants to tear apart veil of birth and reveal “naked nature”

MSUBJ.content: to meet back up with innate nature (in-né), must force the subjectile, rendering it mad from birth, desiring birth
MSUBJ.linkedContent: to meet back up with innate nature (in-né), must force the subjectile, rendering it mad from birth, desiring birth

VM.content: space as wound and finitude of birth
VM.linkedContent: space as wound and finitude of birth

TC.content: a necessary affirmation can be born only by being reborn to itself [theater of cruelty still to be born]
TC.linkedContent: a necessary affirmation can be born only by being reborn to itself [theater of cruelty still to be born]

TC.content: for Artaud, rebirth occurs through reeducation of organs > access to life before birth and after death [affirmation of cruelty], not to death before birth and after life [romantic negativity]
TC.linkedContent: for Artaud, rebirth occurs through reeducation of organs > access to life before birth and after death [affirmation of cruelty], not to death before birth and after life [romantic negativity]

TC.content: theater of cruelty born by separating death from birth and erasing the name of man
TC.linkedContent: theater of cruelty born by separating death from birth and erasing the name of man

TC.content: not think death as a horizon, nor birth as a past opening [re: repetition at origin of theater]
TC.linkedContent: not think death as a horizon, nor birth as a past opening [re: repetition at origin of theater]

FWT.content: [Derrida prefers not to get trapped btwn naturalism/constructivism] differance btwn psyché & genetico-biological laws > always something of a familial bond around birth, impossible to erase “birth,” a certain geneticism, perhaps birth is question of future, of arrival
FWT.linkedContent: [Derrida prefers not to get trapped btwn naturalism/constructivism] differance btwn psyché & genetico-biological laws > always something of a familial bond around birth, impossible to erase “birth,” a certain geneticism, perhaps birth is question of future, of arrival

FWT.content: birth always familial but will come to seem less “natural” [re: “rented belly” (utero in affitto)]
FWT.linkedContent: birth always familial but will come to seem less “natural” [re: “rented belly” (utero in affitto)]

POOF.content: in Menexenus, must summon dead to be responsible before them, the dead are made to be born again: oath of this co-engagement thus resembles a fraternal conjuration
POOF.linkedContent: in Menexenus, must summon dead to be responsible before them, the dead are made to be born again: oath of this co-engagement thus resembles a fraternal conjuration

ROP.content: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel
ROP.linkedContent: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel

SP.content: this death [in text] not that of tragedy nor subject, not “I am mortal, therefore…” > the scene of text’s cryptic nature makes possible anticipation of death: tragedy, parody & birth
SP.linkedContent: this death [in text] not that of tragedy nor subject, not “I am mortal, therefore…” > the scene of text’s cryptic nature makes possible anticipation of death: tragedy, parody & birth

OTO.content: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]
OTO.linkedContent: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]

OTO.content: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]
OTO.linkedContent: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]

PS.content: for Artaud, God is false value of initial worth of what is born: this false value becomes Value, for it doubled what never existed > the work (excrement) repeats this theft, steals another part of me [dispossessing my nonexistent ur-value prior to exiting the Orifice]
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, God is false value of initial worth of what is born: this false value becomes Value, for it doubled what never existed > the work (excrement) repeats this theft, steals another part of me [dispossessing my nonexistent ur-value prior to exiting the Orifice]

PS.content: God is proper name of what deprives us of our own nature, our own birth
PS.linkedContent: God is proper name of what deprives us of our own nature, our own birth

SW.content: wait w/out horizon & someone else one knows too well, “even me why not,” an other yet to be born, who strikes dumb order of knowledge > too well-known, stranger head to foot
SW.linkedContent: wait w/out horizon & someone else one knows too well, “even me why not,” an other yet to be born, who strikes dumb order of knowledge > too well-known, stranger head to foot

TB.content: less revelation than promise: “infinite rebirth (Aufleben) of languages”
TB.linkedContent: less revelation than promise: “infinite rebirth (Aufleben) of languages”

TB.content: translation, as holy growth of languages, announces messianic end, but sign of end only “present” in “knowledge of that distance,” Entfernung, remoteness
TB.linkedContent: translation, as holy growth of languages, announces messianic end, but sign of end only “present” in “knowledge of that distance,” Entfernung, remoteness

TR.content: Marion [who Rousseau falsely accused of stealing a ribbon] was fertilized w/ ink through ribbon of a terrible & tireless writing machine [Apple printer—forbidden fruit joke]
TR.linkedContent: Marion [who Rousseau falsely accused of stealing a ribbon] was fertilized w/ ink through ribbon of a terrible & tireless writing machine [Apple printer—forbidden fruit joke]

EJQB.content: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord
EJQB.linkedContent: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord

IW.content: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig] “unheard-of” singularity of Jewish nation: its birth belongs to (God’s) Law, not to nature > inscribed in a history that began before it was born (though it was already its own)—history of this nation: supernatural, transhistorical, prehistoric
IW.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig] “unheard-of” singularity of Jewish nation: its birth belongs to (God’s) Law, not to nature > inscribed in a history that began before it was born (though it was already its own)—history of this nation: supernatural, transhistorical, prehistoric

C.content: coffin giving birth (a generator, genetrix): incalculable descendance [Phaedo]
C.linkedContent: coffin giving birth (a generator, genetrix): incalculable descendance [Phaedo]

TN.content: when Nancy gives thought to birth of body, it’s sarcastic [having it out w/ flesh], mordant, une transsubstantiation acharnée qui inlassablement mord, remord et met à mort la chair > impossible auto-biography, transubstantiation of Eucharist itself: Corpus bursts out laughing
TN.linkedContent: when Nancy gives thought to birth of body, it’s sarcastic [having it out w/ flesh], mordant, une transsubstantiation acharnée qui inlassablement mord, remord et met à mort la chair > impossible auto-biography, transubstantiation of Eucharist itself: Corpus bursts out laughing

ATM.content: there is no Hegelian Phoenix after Levinas’ consummation of me [i.e. not Me] for the other [passivity more passive…], no being reborn from out the ashes
ATM.linkedContent: there is no Hegelian Phoenix after Levinas’ consummation of me [i.e. not Me] for the other [passivity more passive…], no being reborn from out the ashes

CIN.content: [“Ah no, above all not”] Phoenix, the mark, in my fundamental language
CIN.linkedContent: [“Ah no, above all not”] Phoenix, the mark, in my fundamental language

OG.content: Lévi-Strauss appeals to an “epigenetist” leap from speech to writing: born suddenly
OG.linkedContent: Lévi-Strauss appeals to an “epigenetist” leap from speech to writing: born suddenly

OG.content: structuralism needs  the logic of “born by chance” to maintain structure
OG.linkedContent: structuralism needs the logic of “born by chance” to maintain structure

OG.content: Rousseau: writing (of sounds) born all at once, like light
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: writing (of sounds) born all at once, like light

OG.content: Rousseau looks for a limit “being born (naissante)”: childhood, God, pure language w/out supplement—alibi, in illo tempore
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau looks for a limit “being born (naissante)”: childhood, God, pure language w/out supplement—alibi, in illo tempore

OG.content: Rousseau of Essay describes the presque society, subtle passage from origin to genesis; in Discourse he lays out a radical virgin origin > these 2 “origins” complement each other
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau of Essay describes the presque society, subtle passage from origin to genesis; in Discourse he lays out a radical virgin origin > these 2 “origins” complement each other

OG.content: impossible to describe continuity, passage, from inarticulate to articulate, pure nature to culture, plenitude to play of supplementarity > Rousseau attempts to reconcile (concilier) the 2 times after describing the birth, the being-born, of supplement
OG.linkedContent: impossible to describe continuity, passage, from inarticulate to articulate, pure nature to culture, plenitude to play of supplementarity > Rousseau attempts to reconcile (concilier) the 2 times after describing the birth, the being-born, of supplement

OG.content: Rousseau’s “catastrophic” birth of supplement prescribed by chain of concepts
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s “catastrophic” birth of supplement prescribed by chain of concepts

OG.content: for Rousseau, birth of society not a passage but a pure, fictive, unstable point > post-originary degradation analogous to pre-originary repetition
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, birth of society not a passage but a pure, fictive, unstable point > post-originary degradation analogous to pre-originary repetition

OG.content: if culture is broached w/in its point of origin—no linear order > morrow = eve of festival
OG.linkedContent: if culture is broached w/in its point of origin—no linear order > morrow = eve of festival

OG.content: MOP in Rousseau appears wherever fatality of supplement seems to limit it, he is more interested in presence of the present, essence as presence, as life, as self-presence, energeai, as re-birth (permits all repetitions/returns of origin)—no memory, no anticipation, no souvenir, no distinction, point d’eau, an unimaginable pleasure, the sleeping imagination [Rousseau’s beautiful depiction in Reveries…]
OG.linkedContent: MOP in Rousseau appears wherever fatality of supplement seems to limit it, he is more interested in presence of the present, essence as presence, as life, as self-presence, energeai, as re-birth (permits all repetitions/returns of origin)—no memory, no anticipation, no souvenir, no distinction, point d’eau, an unimaginable pleasure, the sleeping imagination [Rousseau’s beautiful depiction in Reveries…]

OG.content: for Derrida, there’s an interior doubling of presence, a constitution/frustration of jouissance, a call & trace that Rousseau tries to elude
OG.linkedContent: for Derrida, there’s an interior doubling of presence, a constitution/frustration of jouissance, a call & trace that Rousseau tries to elude

SPEC.content: State, multicellular society, socius, guarding life beyond death of any given subject, serves to reproduce & rejuvenate other cells
SPEC.linkedContent: State, multicellular society, socius, guarding life beyond death of any given subject, serves to reproduce & rejuvenate other cells
